title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 510 - Rules Of The Court Of Appeals In Capital Cases
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 510 - Rules Of The Court Of Appeals In Capital Cases

State Regulations
§ 510.1 - Papers
§ 510.2 - Duties of trial-level capital defense counsel
§ 510.3 - Notice of appeal
§ 510.4 - Stays of execution: automatic or determined by superior court
§ 510.5 - Stays of execution: requests to the Court of Appeals
§ 510.6 - Case history
§ 510.7 - Poor person relief; assignment of counsel
§ 510.8 - Capital appeal management orders; issue identification by the parties
§ 510.9 - Preliminary appeal statements
§ 510.10 - Record transcription and reproduction; settlement
§ 510.11 - Record on appeal; appendix; briefs
§ 510.12 - Motions
§ 510.13 - Notice to the Attorney General
§ 510.14 - Post-argument communications
§ 510.15 - Withdrawal of appeal or motion
§ 510.16 - Notice to the capital defender office
§ 510.17 - Remittitur
§ 510.18 - Capital case data reports

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. B, ch. I, subch. B, pt. 510

Statutory authority: Judiciary Law, §§51, 52

Preamble: Preamble:Acting pursuant to the rulemaking
authority invested in this Court by New York Constitution, article VI, §
30, Judiciary Law § 51 and Laws of 1995, chapter 1, the Court of Appeals
establishes these Rules of the Court of Appeals in Capital Cases. Unless
otherwise specified, these Rules apply to all appeals taken pursu ant to C PL
450.70, 450.80 and 460.40(3). State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
